geo_coordinates.rel_pos: This site is at an elevation of about 4300 feet near the headwaters of an unnamed creek 3 miles west of Awlinyak Creek. It is in the SE1/4 of sec. 8, T. 24 N., R. 20 E., of the Kateel River Meridian.  Accuracy of the location is within 1000 ft.  The site corresponds to locality 31 of Grybeck and Nelson (1981).

comment.cmt_txt: Model Name = Skarn (Cox and Singer, 1986; model 14b)
Other Comments = Located within Gates of the Arctic National Park.

Geologic Description = This occurrence consists of locally prominent copper staining in several cliffs near the contact of Devonian gneissic granite with Paleozoic chlorite schist and quartzite (Grybeck and Nelson, 1981).  Grab samples that had visible fluorite and chlorite contained up to 3 ppm Ag, 300 ppm Bi, and 100 ppm Sn.  A brief examination suggests that the occurrences are erratic and small.  They probably are similar in origin to other Devonian contact-metamorphic deposits in nearby areas of the Brooks Range (Newberry and others, 1986).
Age = Devonian; related to the intrusion of Devonian pluton.
Workings / Exploration = Site examined during regional geologic mapping by the USGS in the late 1970s.

bib_references.refs: Grybeck, D.J., and Nelson, S.W., 1981, Mineral deposit map of the Survey Pass quadrangle, Brooks Range, Alaska:  U.S. Geological Survey Miscellaneous Field Studies Map MF-1176-F, 1 sheet, scale 1:250,000.
Newberry, R.J., Dillon, J.T., and Adams, D.D., 1986, Regionally metamorphosed calc-silicate-hosted deposits of the Brooks Range, northern Alaska: Economic Geology, v. 81, p. 1728-1752
